qa_summary.question: According to the hospitalization records of Oxford General Hospital, summarize the present illness of G. Gonzalez.
qa_summary.answer: The illness started 2 days ago at home with a sudden onset and no identifiable triggers. The main symptoms include severe sharp pain in the left lower back radiating to the groin, persistent and unrelenting, worsened by movement, and partially alleviated by lying still. Accompanying symptoms are frequent urination, urgency, visible blood in urine, low-grade fever, and occasional chills. She visited a primary care physician, where urinalysis showed hematuria, and initial analgesics provided minimal effect. Her general condition includes reduced appetite and insomnia due to pain, regular bowel movements, and a slight increase in the frequency of urination.
ref: Present Illness:
Onset: Started 2 days ago at home; sudden onset; no identifiable triggers; progressive worsening of pain
Main Symptoms: Severe sharp pain in left lower back; radiating to the groin; persistent and unrelenting; worsened by movement; partially alleviated by lying still
Accompanying Symptoms: Frequent urination, urgency, and visible blood in urine; low-grade fever; occasional chills
Diagnosis and Treatment History: Visited primary care physician; urinalysis showed hematuria; initial analgesics provided with minimal effect
General Condition Changes: Reduced appetite and insomnia due to pain; regular bowel movements; slight increase in frequency of urination
